forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 56. South southeast wind 20 to 28 mph, with gusts as high as 44 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 18 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
Under the draping blanket of clouds, Downtown San Francisco is steeped in a relentless drizzle that will persist throughout the night. The sultry air, tinged with the salt from the bay, envelops the city, as gusty winds shake loose the autumn leaves and bring a chill that seeps through layers of clothing. With temperatures hovering around a mild 56 degrees, the streets may glisten under a canopy of gray, transformed into a shimmering montage of puddles. Looking to tomorrow, anticipate a continuation of this wet pattern accompanied by slightly warmer air, but do not expect a retreat from the clouds; instead, they will guide the high into the low 60s, marking a day when the sky remains an indistinct haze.

As you navigate through this urban landscape, it is advisable to don a waterproof jacket and sturdy shoes, ready to absorb the moisture underfoot. The insistence of the rain might deter grand outdoor adventures; yet, this weather is perfectly suited for intimate strolls through the eclectic neighborhoods or perhaps a quiet moment at a café, where you can watch droplets race each other down the windows. There’s a certain charm in this subdued ambiance—a reminder that even amidst the storm, life flows on, the city’s heartbeat unwavering and steadfast, a mosaic of resilience wrapped in mist and mystery.
